channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked drains, 26th December
item.description:
I’ve reported this before and the other week o saw a gully sucker going through Stoke orchard and stop by the motorway bridge heading toward the old spot/elmstone hard wick, now I thought they would do the gullies as I reported before but no they’re still block filled with leaves and mud both sides of the bridge some with grass sticking up. After we had heavy rain last week and the week before it just runs over the top and water collects down by the junction of stoke Toad by swan lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlights still not working on Wymans and Thames Roads, 25th December
item.description:
First reported on 7th December. Lights still not working on both roads on 25th December. No information given to residents about the issue and when it is likely to be fixed. Very dangerous walking at night now especially as the roads are also covered in potholes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Colne Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree fallen down, partially blocking road, 24th December
item.description:
Road between Colesbourne and Withington. Tree supported by trees opposite but will block road completely if falls further. Verge being eroded and worsening road surface where vehicles are driving around.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withington, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Large drop off at edge of road, 24th December
item.description:
As you travel towards court farm shop away from bishops cleeve there is a significant damage to the verge and drop off into a ditch. Appears as though an hgv has caused damaged and if any vehicle would make a Minor mistake it would cause a nasty accident. There is no margin for error whatsoever.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The metal bin liner has been taken, 24th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: It's on the footpath on hillfield, 24th December
item.description:
No option for "permanent on" This light seems to be on 24/7, I had forgotten but I've been living here 2 years now and it's on 24/7. Is a waist height lamp on th footpath. I don't know of anyone could fix it. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Hillfield, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Considerable water leak, raised manhole type cover in road, 23rd December

The black ┌ marking on the 'No right turn' sign on this island, facing Westal Green/Gloucester, has completely faded, leaving a red circle and red diagonal bar with a completely white background., 23rd December
item.description:
Larger of two islands at Gordon Lamp junction of A40 Lansdown Road/Lansdown Crescent/Parabola Road, Cheltenham. What3Words = swing.love.camera.

item.title: Pothole as road narrows, 23rd December
item.description:
Up the road there is water bubbling through the tarmac (I previously raised a ticket for this last month which appears to have been closed with no resolution). The water flows down and across the road and is now eroding the road creating this sharp edged pothole. It is outside the farm. About 2’ long and 10” wide.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
